    • Constructor Detail

      • HighlightingDefinition

        public HighlightingDefinition(boolean bActive,
                              java.lang.String strInputColumn,
                              HighlightingDefinition.Type type,
                              java.awt.Color color,
                              boolean bNeighborhood)
        Creates a new highlighting definition.
        Parameters:
        bActive - True, if this condition shall be checked, false otherwise.
        strInputColumn - The input column name. Can be be null.
        type - The index type found in the input column. Must not be null.
        color - Highlighting color or null to use default. Can be null.
        bNeighborhood - Flag to determine highlighting of direct neighborhood. This is a bond between two highlighted atoms or the atoms around a highlighted bond.

      • HighlightingDefinition

        public HighlightingDefinition(Config config,
                              int index)
                       throws InvalidSettingsException
        Creates a new highlighting definition by reading its settings from a config object from the specified index. If the name cannot be found, it will fail. If some other setting is not found it will fall back to use a default value.
        Parameters:
        config - Settings configurations. Must not be null.
        index - Index of settings to read from. Must be valid.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the name of the definition was not found in the config object under the specified index. Also thrown, if null was passed in as config parameter.

      • HighlightingDefinition

        public HighlightingDefinition(HighlightingDefinition orig)
        Creates a new highlighting definition by reading its settings from a config object from the specified index. If the name cannot be found, it will fail. If some other setting is not found it will fall back to use a default value.
        Parameters:
        config - Settings configurations. Must not be null.
        index - Index of settings to read from. Must be valid.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the name of the definition was not found in the config object under the specified index. Also thrown, if null was passed in as config parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • saveSettings

        public void saveSettings(Config config,
                         int index)
        Stores the highlighting definition settings in the specified config object.
        Parameters:
        config - Settings configurations. Must not be null.
        index - Index of settings to write to.

        public boolean isActive()
        Determines, if this condition is active.
        Returns:
        True, if active, false otherwise.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean bActive)
        Sets the flag to activate or deactivate this highlighting definition.
        Parameters:
        bActive - True to activate, false to deactivate.

        Sets the highlighting color. Set to null to use default.
        Parameters:

      • getColor

        Returns the highlighting color to be used.
        Returns:
        Color or null to use default.

      • getRdkitColor

        public DrawColour getRdkitColor()
        Returns the highlighting color in RDKit style to be used.
        Returns:
        RDkit Color object or null to use default.

      • setIncludeNeighborhood

        public void setIncludeNeighborhood(boolean m_bNeighborhood)
        Sets the neighborhood mode for highlighting. If true, bonds between highlighted atoms will be highlighted as well, and atoms around highlighted bonds will be highlighted as well. If false, it will only highlight the defined items (atoms or bonds).
        Parameters:
        m_bNeighborhood -

      • isNeighborhoodIncluded

        public boolean isNeighborhoodIncluded()
        Determines, if the neighborhood is included for highlighting.
        Returns:
        If true, bonds between highlighted atoms will be highlighted as well, and atoms around highlighted bonds will be highlighted as well. If false, it will only highlight the defined items (atoms or bonds).
